pageContent: Introduction: Exploring symptom experiences of older men during metastatic prostate cancer treatment can help clinicians identify unmet supportive care needs that, if addressed, could improve toxicity management and enhance patient wellbeing. Previous qualitative studies of older adults with advanced prostate cancer have focused on the psychological experience rather than the overall symptom experience. Therefore, the objective of this study was to understand the lived experience of symptoms and supportive care needs in older men undergoing treatment for metastatic prostate cancer.

metaData.source:
Racial Differences in Prostate Cancer Treatment: The Role of Socioeconomic Status
https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/28811730/
